source_sentence: 佛說月光童子經
translation: Sutra of the Boy Candraprabha

source_sentence: 西晉月氏三藏竺法護譯
translation: Translation of the Tripiṭaka of the Yuezhi Family of the Western Jin Dynasty by Zhu Fahou

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛遊王舍城靈鷲山，與大比丘眾千人俱，聖通無礙悉皆應真，漏結已解生死已斷，穢冥已索慧明獨存；菩薩二萬，神通聖達統都三界，總攝諸法權慧無方，逮佛神德住無所住。
translation: Thus I heard: One time, the Buddha traveled to the city of Rājagṛha on Vulture Peak, where he was joined by a large assembly of a thousand monks, all of whom were true in their noble abilities and lack of impediment, had freed themselves from the bond of contamination, had cut birth-and-death, had surrendered defilement and darkness, and had insight alone; 20,000 bodhisattvas with superb supernormal abilities and noble penetration unified the three realms, collected all dharmas in an expedient way, and grasped the Buddha's supernormal powers to abide in an unbounded way.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊遊於王舍大城之中，廣演道義開化群生，天神、地神、海靈、鬼神、帝王、臣民、三界眾生皆來稽首，供養神化。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān traveled around the great city of Rājagṛha, expounding the teachings and enlightening sentient beings, and gods of gods, gods of the earth, sea spirits, ghosts, emperors, subjects, and sentient beings in the three realms all came to pay their respects and make offerings to the miraculous transformation.

source_sentence: 世無佛時，外道興隆，猶如冥夜炬燭為明；天下有佛群邪盡歇，譬如日出火無復光，國中本事外道邪見不蘭迦葉等六師，佛以正真之道訓誨天下。
translation: When the world didn't have a Buddha, non-Buddhists prospered like torches and candles shining in the dark of night; when the world had a Buddha, all the heretics stopped, like when the sun rises and the fire doesn't shine again, and there were six teachers in the country who held to the mistaken view of non-Buddhists, such as Pūraṇa-kāśyapa, and the Buddha instructed the world in the true path.

source_sentence: 是時，六師盡廢不見信奉，諸異道等心懷嫉妬，謀欲毀佛還望敬事。
translation: At the time, the six teachers had all abandoned their faith, and the heretics and others were jealous and wanted to disparage the Buddha and return to their venerable service.

source_sentence: 於是，六師召其門徒、合眾弟子會於一處，共集論議：「吾等道德高遠名著四海，眾儒共宗國主所奉，人民男女莫不信仰，於十六大國盡世供養。
translation: The six masters then summoned their disciples and assembled the disciples in one place and discussed, "Our lofty reputation for morality is so well-known that we're respected by the lords of many scholars and countries, and our people, both men and women, believe in us and make offerings to the sixteen great countries throughout the world.

source_sentence: 吾德如風民應如草，靡不稽首各等足下者；今佛出世現神道化，吾等便為人棄不見信奉，乃令我等飲食不甘臥起不安，出入行步恒懷愁憒，心中欝毒悉欲發狂，當作何計以毀辱之？
translation: Our virtue is like the wind, and people should be like grass, so they always bow to our feet. Now that the Buddha has appeared in the world to manifest the miraculous transformation of the Way, we've been discarded by people who don't believe in it, making us unhappy with our food and drink, uneasy when we lie down, constantly worried when we walk in and out, and desirous of going crazy with the venom in our hearts.

source_sentence: 逐使出國令人不見，爾乃還復吾供養耳。」
translation: They then sent us out of the country so that we wouldn't see them, and then they would return our offerings."

source_sentence: 共議此已，各相謂言：「羅閱大城之中有勢強長者，國相大臣名為申日，信奉吾等執心不二，恒毀佛道以為虛偽，惟有此人勢力威強，能助我等毀辱除去。」
translation: After they had discussed this together, they each said, "There's a powerful elder in Rājagṛha's great city, a minister of state named Śinri, who believes in us and adheres to our minds as nondual and always denigrates the Buddha's way as false; only this person is powerful and authoritative, and he can help us disparage and remove it."

source_sentence: 於是六師即從坐起，將五百弟子到王舍大城詣申日家。
translation: The six masters then rose from their seats and sent 500 of their disciples to the great city of Rājagṛha to visit his home.

source_sentence: 申日見諸師來，即下正殿迎為作禮，施好榻机飯食畢盥，拱手對坐。
translation: When he saw the teachers coming, Śīnri went down to the main hall, welcomed them, paid homage, made a nice sofa, finished eating, and sat down with his arms folded.

source_sentence: 諸師告曰：「吾等故與大眾來造長者，欲議一事願垂聽省。」
translation: The teachers told him, "That's why we've come with the others to pay our respects to the elder, and we'd like to discuss a matter, so please listen to us."

source_sentence: 申日白言：「惟蒙訓誨，願樂欲聞。」
translation: Shenmitsu said, "I've been instructed, and I'd like to hear about it."

source_sentence: 六師俱曰：「吾等此國之師，功名勳著群儒稽首，國主致敬大臣所奉，於十六大國獨言隻步。
translation: The six masters all said, "We masters of this country are distinguished by our reputation, are held in high esteem by scholars, and are venerated by our lord and ministers, who speak alone in the 16 great countries.

source_sentence: 長者所知，佛出於世自稱聖智，幻術欺巧倒正反說，欲與吾等列聖併智，齊威等神幻惑人民。
translation: As the elders know, the Buddha appeared in the world claiming to be noble and wise, and he deceived people with his illusory techniques, saying incorrectly and correctly that he wanted to join us in ranking sages and combining wisdom with the same authoritative power and other spirits to delude the people.

source_sentence: 國人愚冥信奉其道，疑惑天下沮敗善心，更謂吾等無有道德不見信奉。
translation: The country's people are foolish and faithful to his way, and they doubt the world and discourage goodness, saying that we have no morals and don't see faith.

source_sentence: 長者豪強，帝王所欽國民伏信，威振四海天下望風，深惟師徒終始義重，記功列勳傳之來世，願為吾等毀辱除之，令滅不見，復吾供養，豈不快哉！」
translation: Wouldn't it be wonderful if our elders, who are powerful and well-respected by the emperor and whose people are subservient to him and whose authority inspires the world to look up to them, were to respect the loyalty of our disciples and record their achievements and legacy for future generations, and to wish to remove our disgrace and humiliation, make them disappear, and restore our offerings?"

source_sentence: 長者啟白：「敬承來告，憶昔往日，我之愚兄奉佛之故毀辱諸師，從此以來實懷忿恚，每欲規圖執事靡由。
translation: The elder revealed, "I respectfully submit, 'I recall a time when my humble brother disrespected our teachers on account of the Buddha, and since then I've really been angry with them and have had no choice but to try to follow their orders.

source_sentence: 今被聖教合我本心，當展力效命盡節於師。」
translation: Now, because the noble teaching agrees with my original intention, I will exert myself and serve my teachers to the fullest."

source_sentence: 諸梵志曰：「吾向共議，欲令長者當於門中，鑿作五丈六尺深坑，以炭火適半細鐵為椽土薄覆上，設眾飲食以毒著中，若火坑不焚毒飯足害，便往請佛。
translation: The priests said, "We've been discussing this together, 'We want the elder to dig a pit five feet by six feet deep inside the gate, cover it with a charcoal fire and half a dozen thin iron rafters and a thin layer of dirt, and set up a poisonous food and drink puddle in it.

source_sentence: 佛常自云有三達之智，神通無礙，照見未然，明禍福之原、吉凶所趣，實無此分，而但誑惑萬姓，審有此智當不受請，若無此智必自受之，今欲以此規圖於佛。」
translation: The Buddha always claims to have the wisdom of the three penetrations, unimpeded supernormal powers, unimpeded insight, knowledge of the origin of misfortune and fortune, and the destinies of fortune and misfortune, but he really has no such part.

source_sentence: 申日聞之，欣然大悅讚言：「善哉！
translation: When he heard this, Sunil was delighted and greatly pleased, praising him, "Good!

source_sentence: 誠如大師之所教勅，此謀深密高妙實為奇異，以此圖之何憂不獲。
translation: As the great teacher had taught and commanded, this scheme is so profound and subtle that it's truly marvelous; why wouldn't I worry about not getting it this way?

source_sentence: 輒如聖教，作火坑毒飯，嚴以待之。」
translation: I will then do as the sages have taught, making a fiery pit of poisoned rice and treating it with respect."

source_sentence: 爾時，不蘭迦葉五百弟子，見申日計共謀同，歡喜踊躍不能自勝，咸共起住，同聲舉手稱讚申日：「善哉！
translation: At the time, five hundred of Pūraṇa-kāśyapa's disciples saw that Shenmitsu was scheming together, and they were overwhelmed with joy and excitement as they all rose and stayed together, raising their hands in unison and praising Shenmitsu, "Good!

source_sentence: 真是聖明第一弟子。」
translation: He's really the first disciple of shōkyō."

source_sentence: 申日重啟：「今自憂之，必自嚴辦，比令明日諸師當見。」
translation: On the repetition of the day, he said, "Now, I'm worried about this, so I'll make sure I do it with care, just so the teachers will see it tomorrow."

source_sentence: 長者禮已，諸師各還。
translation: After the elder paid homage, the teachers each returned.

source_sentence: 於是，申日勅外嚴駕導從前後，便詣佛所，下車却蓋，解劍脫履，拱手直進，稽首足畢，長跪白佛：「唯然，世尊！
translation: Thereupon, Śrī Siṃha messengers led them from front to back, went to the Buddha, dismounted, removed their hoods, untied their swords, took off their shoes, marched straight in with their arms arched, bowed their heads at their feet, and knelt down long enough to say, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 飢渴神化樂仰清風，世事多緣奉敬靡由，今故請現稽首稟化。」
translation: I'm hungry and thirsty for the miraculous transformation, and I long for the clear breeze, which is the cause of so many worldly problems and so little respect, so now I invite you to present yourself and present yourself to the transformation."

source_sentence: 佛告賢者：「明日至心向於如來。」
translation: The Buddha told the good man, "Tomorrow, I'll wholeheartedly present myself to the Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 申日啟言：「明日欲設微飯，惟願世尊與諸聖眾降德屈神。」
translation: On that day, he revealed, "Tomorrow, I'd like to serve a light meal, but may the Bhagavān and the noble ones subdue their spirits."

source_sentence: 是時，世尊愍其狂愚，欲濟脫之，默然受請。
translation: The Bhagavān then pitied his foolishness and wanted to rescue him, so he quietly accepted the invitation.

source_sentence: 申日內喜，心自念言：「果如規計。」
translation: He rejoiced internally on the morrow and said to himself, "It's just as planned."

source_sentence: 禮畢辭退。
translation: After the ceremony, he withdrew.

source_sentence: 過六師所，諸師迎問：「為受請不？」
translation: When he passed the six masters, they greeted him and asked, "Did you accept the invitation?"

source_sentence: 申日啟白：「承諸師威力，已受我請，果如所圖。」
translation: On the morrow, he revealed, "I acknowledge the authority of the teachers who have accepted my invitation, and it's just as I had planned."

source_sentence: 諸師及五百弟子皆大歡喜不能自勝，諸梵志等普喜並言：「長者速還，作火坑、毒飯，嚴以待之。」
translation: The teachers and 500 disciples were overjoyed, and the priests and others rejoiced and said, "Sir, you must quickly return home and make a fire pit and poisoned rice to wait for him."

source_sentence: 長者還家，勅外密令，中門外掘作火坑、毒飯嚴以待之。
translation: When the elder returned home, I sent a secret order to the outside world to dig a fire pit outside the middle gate and prepare a poisoned meal to make it more tolerable.

source_sentence: 長者有子，名曰月光，厥年十六，天姿挺特儀容端正，博通群籍貫綜神摸，天文、地理靡不照焉，高名動世群儒師仰，慈悲愍世生死之苦，降德普入欲度眾生，諫父申日：「佛為大聖三界之尊，道德清淨言教真正，三達之聖慈悲喜護，心過慈母當蒙得度，更興逆惡悕望天福，豈不惑哉？
translation: The elder had a son named Yuehwang, who was 16 years old and had a strong, distinguished, and correct demeanor. He was well-versed in many books, had a comprehensive knowledge of astronomy and geography, and could illuminate them all.

source_sentence: 「昔者，世尊求道之日，坐於道場元吉樹下，第六天魔見佛高遠三毒已滅，穢冥以索慧明獨存，神聖無上諸天所宗，上帝親下萬神侍衛，內懷嫉妬心中煩毒，念其道成當必勝我，飲食不甘伎樂不御，即昇正殿召博聞臣，議設方計毀敗其道。
translation: "In the past, on the day the Bhagavān sought the path, he was sitting under the bodhi tree in the site of enlightenment when the sixth celestial demon saw that the Buddha's three poisons had ceased in the distant past, that his wisdom and insight remained alone in the defiled darkness, that he was a member of the noble and peerless gods, and that he was guarded by myriad gods, that he was jealous and had internal afflictions in his mind, that he would surely surpass me in accomplishing his path, that his food and drink were not satisfying, that his music was not subservient, and that he had risen to the main hall and summoned well-versed ministers to discuss ways to disrupt his path.

source_sentence: 群臣啟曰：『菩薩神聖道力無上，威震三界德伏十方，非是臣等所可謀向。』
translation: The ministers replied, 'The power of the bodhisattva's noble path is unsurpassed, and its authority shocks the three realms and subdues the ten directions; it's not something that ministers can contemplate.'

source_sentence: 「於時魔王赫威奮發震曜天地，召諸鬼兵興軍聚眾，帶甲億萬旌旗曀日光曜蔽天，宣勅士眾皆使變化，奇形異類數百千種，蟲頭人軀鬼魅可畏，擔山負石口眼吐火，圍遶菩薩齊聲踏地，牛吼唱噭震動八荒，山崩地裂樹木摧折，海水波蕩踊沸六原，溢流浩汗高波滔天。
translation: "The Māra King then roused his might and roused his troops to shake heaven and earth, summoning them to gather an army with hundreds of millions of armor, banners that covered the sky with sun and light, and announced that the soldiers would all make transformations, taking on hundreds of thousands of strange forms and creatures, insects with heads and bodies, ghosts and demons that were terrifying, carrying mountains and rocks, spitting fire from their mouths, surrounding the bodhisattva with a unified voice that stamped the ground, shouting cries of cattle that shook the eight wildernesses, crumbling mountains and splitting trees, rippling seas that boiled the six plains, and overflowing torrents that caused high waves to swell the heavens.

source_sentence: 百姓驚怖巢木栖山，潛龍妄踊，鷙鳥驚翔，師子慴竄，金翅鳥王魔竭大魚順流低仰，群神怖悸逃走遁藏，千變萬化群凶相將，毒惡逆類彌漫縱橫，一時集惡向於世尊。
translation: The people are terrified, the nesting trees perch on the mountain, the latent dragons spring up, the ferocious birds fly in terror, the lion falters, the garuḍa king and the mahogany fish bow down with the current, the spirits flee and hide in fear, a thousand things change, and a multitude of vicious people converge, and poisonous and unwholesome types spread out and wander about, all at once gathering evil toward the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 「佛直以放慈心之力，舉手指之，群惡鬼兵一時伏擗，齊心叉手頭面自歸。
translation: "When the Buddha directly raised his hand with the power of an open compassionate mind, the army of evil spirits instantly subdued themselves at the restaurant, saluted with their palms together, and returned with their heads and faces.

source_sentence: 當于爾時，如來即便降伏，彌天之惡化為弟子，雖獲得勝無憂喜想。
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata quickly subdued them, and although they had attained victory, they didn't have any sad or joyous thoughts about being a disciple of Maitreya's deteriorating demons.

source_sentence: 以是方之火坑、毒飯何足言乎？
translation: What's enough to say about this place's fiery pit and poisoned rice?

source_sentence: 須彌之毒大千剎火，刀劍矛刃亦不能動佛一毛也，今以火坑、毒飯欲毀於佛，譬如蚊虻之勢欲墜大山，蠅蠛之翅欲障日月，徒自毀碎，不如早悔首過免罪。
translation: Even the poison of Sumeru's great thousand blazes and the blades of swords and spears can't touch a hair of the Buddha's head, so now when he wants to disparage the Buddha with a fire pit or a poisoned meal, he's like a gnat with the power to fall down a great mountain or a fly with wings that want to obstruct the sun and moon, which only destroys himself.

source_sentence: 「天龍、鬼神、世間、人民、梵釋、魔王莫不稽顙受佛化者。
translation: "Gods, dragons, spirits, the world, people, Brahmā, Śākyamuni, and Māra Kings all revere those who accept the Buddha's transformation.

source_sentence: 如來之身金剛德體，眾惡盡滅萬善積著，相好光明神器無喻，永除五道之大冥，獲無上正真之獨明，處眾聖之上猶星中之月，如日初出照於朝陽，廣陳道化導世凶愚，懷慈四等愍傷眾生，施恩濟苦心過慈母。
translation: The Tathāgata's adamantine body is endowed with the virtuous essence, all evil is extinguished, ten thousand good attachments are accumulated, his features are brilliant, his divine apparatus is without metaphor, he permanently removes the great darkness of the five destinies, attains the unique insight of unsurpassed correctness, stands above the sages like the moon among the stars, shines like the sun first rising in the morning sun, explains the ways and teachings in detail, guides the world's fierce foolishness, harbors kindness for the four kinds of pity for sentient beings, and gives kindness to relieve suffering with a heart greater than a loving mother's.

source_sentence: 佛之道德神化如此，願父改悔歸命三尊。」
translation: Thus is the Buddha's moral and miraculous transformation, and I hope my father will repent and return to the three honored ones."

source_sentence: 爾時，長者申日罪蓋所蔽心不開解，告子月光：「假使如來之德如子所歎，佛有神通照見未然者，當豫知我作火坑、毒飯，今何以故受吾之請？
translation: At the time, the elder Shenil, who was hindered by the hindrance of his sins and whose mind was not liberated, told his son Yueguang, "Suppose the Tathāgata's virtue were as his son praised, and the Buddha had the supernormal power to see what's not yet the case, then he would have known in advance that I had made a fiery pit and poisoned rice; why would he accept my invitation now?

source_sentence: 以此推之知無遠慮。」
translation: By this reckoning, you know there's no such thing as far-reaching concern."

source_sentence: 月光復言：「佛實有三達之智、六通之明、大慈四等靡不貫綜，常度愚闇不逆人意。」
translation: Moonlight then said, "The Buddha really has the three kinds of penetrating wisdom, the six kinds of supernormal knowledge, and the four kinds of great compassion that are not universally shared, and he always saves the foolish and doesn't oppose people's wishes."

source_sentence: 申日心迷執愚不捨，明旦遣人請佛，使者受教詣世尊所，長跪白佛言：「長者申日啟言：『日時已至飯食以具，惟願舉眾降德自屈。』」
translation: Shenmitsu's deluded mind clings to folly and doesn't abandon it. Tomorrow, he sent for the Buddha, and the messenger was instructed to go to the Bhagavān, kneel down long enough, and say to the Buddha, "Shenmitsu, the elder, revealed, 'The sun has arrived and the food is ready, may I ask the multitude to subdue themselves.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊心自念言：「今受申日之請不與常同，當放威神感動十方，令子心伏必就大道廣化無涯，并化六師及九十六種外道。」
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān said to himself, "Now, accepting Shenmi's invitation, I'm not the same as usual; I will unleash my mighty spirit to move the ten directions, so that my son's mind will be subdued and he'll attain the great way and teach endlessly, as well as the six masters and ninety-six kinds of non-Buddhists."

source_sentence: 於時，世尊放大光明，上照三十三天，下徹十八地獄，極佛境界皆大光明神通。
translation: The Bhagavān then radiated a bright light that shone up from the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and down to the eighteen hells, and it was a great radiant supernormal power that reached the very realm of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 菩薩、羅漢、緣覺，梵釋天王、海靈地祇及諸鬼兵，各將部黨億萬無數，聞度申日，皆來詣佛，稽首足畢，翼從左右。
translation: Bodhisattvas, arhats, pratyekabuddhas, Brahmakāyika gods, sea spirits, earth deities, and demon soldiers, each with hundreds of thousands of troops, came to the Buddha after hearing about the Tathāgata's birthday, bowed their heads at their feet, and followed him to his right and left.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「執持應器，當就長者申日請。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Hold on to the appropriate vessel and ask the elder to proclaim the day."

source_sentence: 諸比丘咸曰：「受教。」
translation: The monks all said, "Accept the teaching."

source_sentence: 肅然嚴持地即金色，當佛頂上有七步香雲紅黃青紺紫白蓮華，自然涌出俠道兩邊。
translation: As they solemnly and adornedly held the ground, which was gold, there were seven clouds of fragrant red, yellow, blue, purple, and white lotus flowers rising naturally from the Buddha's head on either side of the ruffian's path.

source_sentence: 佛甫出門，告空無吉祥菩薩等六十萬人在前導從，或行虛空，或現於地，佛處中央，其餘無限之眾皆隨佛後，光明赫奕遏日絕月晃照一切，天施寶蓋華下如雪，天龍、飛鳥不敢歷上，三界眾生無見頂者，天樂皆下同時俱作，毒蟲隱伏吉鳥翔鳴，佛不蹈地相輪印成，光明晃耀七日熾盛。
translation: As soon as the Buddha leaves the gate, he tells 600,000 people, including the auspicious bodhisattva Kongwu, to precede him and follow him, either walking through the sky or appearing on the ground, with the Buddha in the center and the rest of the infinite multitude following him, with a brilliant light that shines brightly, curbs the sun, cuts off the moon, and shines brightly on everything, the gods bestow jeweled lids with flowers like snow, celestial dragons and flying birds don't dare to ascend, sentient beings in the three realms have no one who sees their heads, heavenly music falls down at the same time, poisonous insects retreat, and auspicious birds fly, the Buddha doesn't tread on the ground, and the sign of the wheel is formed, shining brightly for seven days and blazing brightly.

source_sentence: 寶樹、藥樹、諸眾果樹，睥睨[跳-兆+叵][跳-兆+我]低仰如人跪禮之形。
translation: The jeweled tree, the medicinal tree, and the many fruit-bearing trees look out [jumps - trillion + un] [jumps - trillion + me] and bow down like men prostrating.

source_sentence: 閱叉、金翅、厭鬼、魅鬼，各將營從莊嚴分部，千百為眾手執伎樂，或持香華、七寶瓔珞、天繒幡蓋。
translation: The yakṣas, goldfinches, loathsome ghosts, and hungry ghosts each disguise themselves in adorned rows, and a thousand or so of them carry music, incense, flowers, seven-jeweled jewelry, and sky-high silken banners.

source_sentence: 十方來會，天人亦下樂器亦鳴。
translation: As they come from ten directions, the gods and humans descend, and their instruments sound.

source_sentence: 盲視聾聽瘂言躄行，怨憎和慈，迷寤醉醒，婦女釵釧相掁作聲，飛鳥、走獸皆作人形。
translation: Blind, deaf, and dumb, speechless, and walking, resentful, hateful, and compassionate, deluded, awake, and drunk, their women's robes and bracelets make noise, and birds and animals fly and walk around in human form.

source_sentence: 百歲枯木自然華生，餓鬼飽滿地獄安寧，琵琶箏笛擊鼓亂鳴。
translation: A hundred-year-old withered tree naturally produces flowers, hungry ghosts fill the hells with tranquility, and lutes, gongs, and flutes beat the drums with disorderly blasts.

source_sentence: 佛以神德變化火坑，即成七寶紫紺浴池八味之水，底有金沙邊有蓮華，魚鼈黿鼉池中喜踊，飛鳥、走獸音聲相和，池邊行列絲竹衣樹，樹間皆懸羅縠緹繡，珊瑚、寶樹、水精、琉璃、黃金、白銀為枝葉，紫磨黃金為繩，連綿交錯樹間，垂天瓔珞互相連結，風起吹之轉相掁觸，妙音百種自然宣出，歎佛神德至未曾有，皆說無常苦空非身之聲，使悲者更喜喜者更悲。
translation: The Buddha's miraculous powers transform the fiery pit into a purple-tinged bath of seven treasures and eight flavors of water with a golden sand at the bottom and lotus flowers at the edges, raining fish and gums in the pool, flying birds and animals harmonizing with each other in sound, rows of silk and bamboo clad trees at the edge of the pool, gauze, lapis lazuli, gold, and silver as branches and leaves, and purple polish and gold as cords, all interlaced with a chain of trees, draped with heavenly jewelry that connects with each other as the wind rises and blows, and a hundred wonderful sounds are naturally proclaimed, praising the Buddha's miraculous powers as unprecedented, and all of them expounding the sound of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and non-self, causing those who are pitiable to become more joyous and those who are joyous to become more pitiable.

source_sentence: 其七寶樹上則有群鳥：孔雀、鸚鵡、金翅鳥王、赤觜神鳥、鳳皇吉鳥、拘耆那羅吉祥鳥，比數百千種，光色顯赫群飛樹間，哀鸞百種感動人情咸來集聽，走獸息食飛禽止聽，形異心同歸命世尊。
translation: On that seven-jeweled tree were a flock of birds: peacocks, parrots, the golden-winged king of birds, the red-billed gods, the phoenix king of birds, the kokila auspicious bird, and hundreds of thousands of other species with brilliant colors flying among the trees, a hundred kinds of sad-rans that moved people's emotions and gathered to listen, and animals that walked around calming their food and birds that flew in to stop listening, all with different forms and minds in common, giving their lives to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 當于爾時，海靈、地祇、三界眾生其來從者，見火坑變為浴池，天地震動，神變若此道德殊絕，皆看申日。
translation: At the time, sea spirits, earth deities, and sentient beings from the three realms who came to follow them saw a fire pit turn into a bathing pool, the heavens shook, and their miracles were so extraordinary that they all looked at Shenmitsu.

source_sentence: 申日見之，心動神驚衣毛起竪，慞惶怖悸精神失守，心自念言：「咄哉！
translation: When they saw that, their minds were shaken and startled, and their hair on their heads rose, and they were perplexed, frightened, and lost their composure.

source_sentence: 迷惑！
translation: Confusion!

source_sentence: 我之逆惡所為無邊。」
translation: There's no limit to what my heinous acts can do."

source_sentence: 顧謂六師：「坐汝畜類沈吾湯火，我今如何？」
translation: Gu said to the six teachers, "Sitting here, you animals are sinking into the fire of my soup.

source_sentence: 六師恐怖慚恥無言，懼獲重罪即各逃竄。
translation: Terrified, ashamed, and speechless, each of the six teachers fled in fear of incurring a grave offense.

source_sentence: 於是，申日與子月光、夫人、婇女、眷屬男女、外道伴黨俱出迎佛。
translation: Thereupon, Sunil, his son Moonlight, his wife, his daughter, his retinue, and their non-Buddhist companions all went out to meet the Buddha.

source_sentence: 遙覩世尊洪焰暉赫晃若寶山，天姿紫金巨容丈六，神顏從容諸根寂定，相三十二好八十種，天中之天道德堂堂，十力世尊天人中王，佛以神德照愚冥心。
translation: They saw the Bhagavān's brilliant flame shining brightly like a jeweled mountain, his celestial form purple-gold with a huge face measuring six feet, his countenance subdued, his faculties calm and collected, his features thirty-two beauties and eighty varieties, the god of gods with a high moral standing, the world-honored one with ten powers, and the king of gods and humans, as the Buddha illuminated the minds of the ignorant with his spiritual virtue.

source_sentence: 申日意解，如迷得正，狂病瘳除，五情內發悲喜交集，即前首罪，五體投地稽首作禮：「唯然，世尊！
translation: He declared that his mind was liberated, as if he'd been deluded and attained correction, was freed from his madness, and was overcome by a mixture of sadness and joy in his five internal emotions, which led him to bow with his head at the feet of his five sins, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 恕我盲冥，不識正真用信惡言，興毒害意欲危天尊，幸賴慈化乞原罪咎，垂哀接濟得免大罪，願前就坐。」
translation: Forgive me for being so blind and ignorant of the truth that I believed bad words and intended to harm the goddess. I'm fortunate that I relied on the compassionate teaching to absolve myself of guilt and to accept your kindness and rescue to be spared a great misdeed.

source_sentence: 即時，如來升于正殿，眾坐已定。
translation: Immediately, the Tathāgata ascended to the main hall, and the congregation was seated.

source_sentence: 申日慚怖心不自安，前白佛言：「為盲冥所誤，信妖邪之言以為真諦，如狂服藥病更增劇，始今覩佛，邪病得除，所為無道飯食之中，悉皆著毒不可供養，以御大聖。
translation: Being conscience and fearful, he said to the Buddha, "Being misled by blindness and darkness, I believed what evil people said and thought was the truth.

source_sentence: 願待須臾更嚴食具。」
translation: Please wait a moment to refine your food preparation."

source_sentence: 佛告長者：「便持飯來，不足更設，貪婬、瞋恚、愚癡、邪見世之重毒，吾無此毒，毒已滅盡，毒不害我。」
translation: The Buddha told the elder, "Bringing the meal then wouldn't be enough; craving, anger, foolishness, and wrong views are heavy poisons of the world, but I don't have such poisons; they've been extinguished, and they won't harm me."

source_sentence: 申日下食，香徹八難，餓鬼得安。
translation: When the sun sets on the meal, the fragrance penetrates the eight difficulties, and the hungry ghosts are brought peace.

source_sentence: 食已行水，眾會寂然。
translation: After the meal, they stand up and offer water, and the congregation is silent.

source_sentence: 申日退坐，垂泣啟言：「唯然，世尊！
translation: Shenmitsu retired from his seat, weeping, he said, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 恕我迷惑，敢圖逆惡向於如來，自揆罪重應入地獄，湯火痛考長夜受苦，將脫何由？
translation: Forgive my delusion, but I dared to rebel against the Tathāgata and consider myself to be in grave danger of being sent to hell, where I'll suffer through a long night of suffering in a hot fire.

source_sentence: 佛為大慈三界之救，愍念眾生濟其塗炭，昨不誡我令我罪成，得無世尊不豫知也。」
translation: The Buddha is the savior of the three realms of great compassion, pities for sentient beings, and helps to scourge them. He didn't admonish me yesterday and caused me to commit a sin that I didn't expect to know."

source_sentence: 佛告申日：「昔定光世尊授我莂時：『汝却後無數阿僧祇劫，當於五濁惡世作佛，廣度眾生如我今日，當有長者申日，火坑、毒飯，規圖害汝。』
translation: The Buddha told Shenri, "When the Bhagavān Dingguang granted me the enlightenment, 'In the countless incalculable eons to come, you will become a buddha in the five turbid and evil worlds and widely save sentient beings like me today, when there will be an elder Shenri who will plan to harm you through a fiery pit and poisoned rice.'

source_sentence: 我乃爾時得明慧三昧，時已豫知汝姓字，況於昨日而當不知。」
translation: At the time, I attained the samādhi of insight, and I already knew your name and surname at that time, so why wouldn't I have known it yesterday?"

source_sentence: 申日歡喜言：「世尊乃豫知無數劫事，我既覺悟會得免罪，今我盡心自歸於佛，所為之非願，令重罪而得微輕。」
translation: Shenmitsu rejoiced and said, "The Bhagavān has known for countless eons, and now that I've realized it, I'll be spared the misdeeds and wholeheartedly turn to the Buddha for what I don't want, so that my heavy misdeeds will be made lighter."

source_sentence: 佛本有誓不捨愚惑，即告申日：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha, who had originally vowed not to abandon foolish delusion, told Shenmitsu, "Good!

source_sentence: 長者！
translation: Elder!

source_sentence: 能自覺悔重罪必除，吾當為汝演說道義，令汝心解。」
translation: If you can repent on your own, your serious sins will be removed, and I will explain the meaning of the Way for you so that your mind will be liberated."

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然，天中天！
translation: He said, "Yes, god of gods!

source_sentence: 願樂欲聞，畢死善道盡心不忘。」
translation: May I wish to hear about it, and I will never forget it after I die on the good path."

source_sentence: 則時世尊謦揚洪音，出八種聲演萬億音，廣說無量法言：八解、四諦、三脫、六度，探道法要微妙之行，解三界空諸法因緣造為罪福，觀病選藥如應說法。
translation: The Bhagavān then raised his voice in a flood, producing eight kinds of sounds that produced a trillion sounds, and spoke in detail about the measureless teachings, including the eight understandings, four truths, three liberations, and six perfections, the subtle conduct of exploring the essentials of the path, understanding the emptiness of the three realms and the causes and conditions of all things that create crimes and merits, and observing illnesses, selecting medicines, and teaching accordingly.

source_sentence: 申日情悟坦然，心開疑解結除，[火*霍]然無想寂然入定，即於座上逮不退轉，喜踊升空去地百四十丈，從空來下稽首于地，嗚佛足、摩佛足，長跪自陳：「今已覺悟從佛得度，欣然嘆佛，佛十力雄哉！
translation: On that day, his feelings and awareness were completely awakened, his mind was opened, the bonds of doubt and liberation were removed, [fire*horn] was calm and without thought, and he calmly entered into meditative concentration.

source_sentence: 如來神力震伏十方無敢當者，火坑、毒飯豫自消亡；佛無憂哉！
translation: The Tathāgata's supernormal power overwhelms those in ten directions who dare not respond, and fire pits and poisoned rice perish on their own; the Buddha has no worries!

source_sentence: 一切刀劍不能害傷，急箭勁刃皆化作華；佛勇猛哉！
translation: "All swords cannot harm, and sharp arrows and powerful blades are turned into flowers; how brave the Buddha is!

source_sentence: 如來皆能降伏邪道九十六種，異口同音皆歎大道；佛金剛哉！
translation: "The Tathāgata is able to subdue ninety-six wrong paths, and with one voice they all praise the great way; how vajra-like is the Buddha!

source_sentence: 佛若金山晃照一切，闇冥壞敗慧火獨明，超度群聖之上德過虛空，辯才不盡開闡法言告於大千，調諸剛強令使熟成，威震三界獨而無侶，離諸塵勞淨若天金，雨諸法寶飽滿一切，施以無盡七大之財，觀心選藥先壞魔兵，如應開法靡不得度，九十六種邪道隱蔽。」
translation: Like a gold mountain, the Buddha shines brightly on all beings, destroying darkness and wisdom fires alone, transcending sages with supreme virtue that transcends space, speaking with inexhaustible eloquence, expounding the Dharma and telling a great chiliocosm, disciplining the stiff and strong, bringing them to maturity, shaking the three realms with authority that's unique and unparalleled, ridding them of the labor of dust that's as pure as heavenly gold, raining down Dharma treasure to fill them all, bestowing an inexhaustible supply of seven great treasures, selecting medicine from contemplation, destroying demon armies first, revealing the Dharma as it should be, and concealing 96 kinds of wrong paths."

source_sentence: 當于，申日歎佛法時，無限之眾其來大會，皆樂法音，得福得度不可稱計。
translation: When the Buddha's teaching was praised on that new day, an unlimited multitude of people came to the assembly, all delighting in the sound of the teaching and attaining fortune and deliverance incalculable.

source_sentence: 天地震動，樂器作聲，第七梵王宣聞法言，琵琶磬鼓千種伎樂自然而鳴，忉利天帝華散佛上，歎佛聖德至未曾有。
translation: As the heavens shook and musical instruments sounded, the seventh Brahma king announced that he had heard the words of the Dharma, a thousand kinds of music and instruments on lutes and bells sounded spontaneously, and the gods of the Thirty-three heavens scattered flowers above the Buddha, praising his holy qualities as unprecedented.

source_sentence: 當此之時，莫不歡喜，稽首作禮而去。
translation: At that point, no one was left without rejoicing, bowing their heads in homage.

source_sentence: 佛說月光童子經
translation: Sutra of the Boy Candraprabha
